sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A bird's eye view of Austin in the French region of Gironde after a hellish week in which more than 7,400 hectares of forest have burned and at least 10,000 people have been evacuated from their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Although they were partially contained during the night, the fires rage on, on one of the hottest days of the summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Firefighters from all over Europe have come to the aid of their French colleagues, who are unable to cope with the sheer number of new outbreaks and the re-emergence of fires that had not been completely extinguished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have 1,100 firefighters present, plus an additional 361 personnel and 101 vehicles from European support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They will arrive, some arrived yesterday, like our German and Romanian friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And then our Austrian and Polish friends will arrive later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen took to social media to praise the solidarity of heroic firefighters across the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Plagued by drought and heat waves, this map shows how large swathes of Europe and North Africa are now in extreme danger of catching fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere, blazes continue to wreak havoc in parts of Greece, Italy and Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And in Portugal, flames have engulfed the Serra del Estrela Natural Park, causing irreparable damage to a World Heritage Site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As London swelters in the blistering heat, the UK government has officially declared a drought in several parts of England, including the Thames.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Following months of record low rainfall and scorching temperatures, water rationing might soon take place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Germany has also not escaped the dry spells which continue to wreak havoc across the country. Water levels have dropped so low that most cargo ships are struggling to pass through a stretch of the river Rhine between Kaub and Mainz. Authorities are now looking for alternative shipping routes and have taken steps to move some goods onto the rail network. Moving east to the Netherlands, floating houses are now stuck in the mud along the river Waal. In a bid to salvage short supplies of well water, farmers have been banned from irrigating their land by day in some parts of the country. Severe drought has hit Southeast Europe too, with ships struggling to navigate the shallow waters of the Danube. Emergency dredging operations are underway so that boats can pass through. At the border between Romania and Bulgaria, where the river has dropped to historic lows, dozens of sand islands have surfaced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Romania's biggest water transportation company says this is the most serious situation it has seen in the last 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This exact spot is the intersection between Romania and Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On the border, the Danube is usually flowing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now we can see sand, a beach on the Romanian side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the continuing heat has increased the temperature of these waterways to over 25 degrees and parts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For sun worshippers, this exceptionally dry summer is a gift.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, most locals are praying for rain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sofia Yezakova is hard at work creating a large-scale drawing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: that represents the Ukrainian soldiers that have died defending their home country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: For a long time, art seemed pointless.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But moving into a Ukrainian art collective here in Berlin has helped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: For the first two months I couldn't pick up a pencil or a brush, couldn't think about anything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Everything seemed useless and meaningless because the war was on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: People were dying, so what could I possibly draw?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But when I arrived here and for the last two weeks in Kiev, I stopped despairing and I started to draw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The art collective called the Ukrainian Cultural Community has been set up with the help of German organizations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 18 Ukrainian artists are living here in a 500-square-meter flat that used to be a brothel right in the center of the German capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think this is a very open metropolis, a city where a lot of cultures interact and also where we have a lot of space, space for people to live, space for people to get support and to meet each other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: and to meet each other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Victoria Temnova is from Kherson, a city in the south of Ukraine that is occupied by Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Back home, she was a well-known fashion photographer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Here in Berlin, she's exhibiting photos from the city from before the war to show people the real face of her home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: My city now has another everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's still Ukraine, but with no rules, with someone who just wanted to do something violent with your people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Around 70,000 Ukrainian refugees are in Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Each person brings their own story, their own sorrows and their own hopes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now migrants and refugees always bring something to the countries where they do end up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And this is of course no exception.

As the world's largest producer, the country boasts some 200,000 coffee bean farms. One such farm is Goyabal, located 150 kilometers northeast of Rio de Janeiro. Growers here are working hard to create their unique speciality brew.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Five of New York City's most iconic dance companies have come together for a festival under the stars. Commissioned by the Lincoln Center, the goal of the shows is to remove barriers for not only those on the stage, but off with free entertainment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Each unique evening of the program has been curated by the artistic directors of the five companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Dancers will also offer daily workshops for all ages. At Lincoln Center, our job is to bring in audiences from all over New York and make sure there's no barriers between them experiencing the best art in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And so we do that in a lot of ways, but one of those ways is free tickets throughout our entire summer programming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And we've been lucky enough to welcome hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers here on campus to see the best work in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's all part of the Band Together Dance Festival, founded more than a century ago by French fashion designer, Gabrielle Chanel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Last year's event was a resounding success, proof that New Yorkers were excited for their beloved dance companies to return to the stage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This year, it goes one step further with the dancers performing side-by-side.
